Rabbit used to be a decent application where two people separated geographically could share a program or movie via Crunchyroll or Amazon.   Since Rabbit has been ‚ÄúUpdated‚Äù all video sharing has been abandoned.  The only website allowed is Netflix  and YouTube.  The only way to share a video off of YouTube is by sending the other person a link to the video.  This application basically downgraded itself to a glorified text messaging app.  After requesting assistance from Rabbit concerning their massive loss in usability and functionality  I was directed to kindly check back later as features were constantly being added. It has been several months and the app has yet to include a fraction of what it used to be.  I would highly recommend not waisting your time with this app and hopefully a suitable competitor will step up to the plate and take this app‚Äôs spot.

Overall i really enjoy rabbit  it‚Äôs a genuinely good app that has fairly decent customer support. However  as a mobile user  I have had some pretty major problems that are really frustrating. For one  when hosting or controlling a room on mobile  the controls are bizarre  with where I click and where the cursor shows up being about a literal inch an a half apart (on iPad  at least) making every movement a game of chance where I may exit the program instead of turn up the volume. In addition  the app has a tendency to kick me out of rooms someone else is hosting about once every ~25 minutes  which is more annoying than anything else. However  the chat function and program itself are genuinely very good  and I still use the app frequently.

At rabb.it that is. I love the app/site & hate it at the same time. I‚Äôve really held off way too long to leave a review. This has been a fairly popular site for a few years and on paper it‚Äôs an awesome idea! But why haven‚Äôt the creators figured it out yet...?  Before the site was difficult for me to navigate  and certain things would take forever to load (trust me it‚Äôs not just my connection).  It had big update recently; haven‚Äôt used the app in maybe a month so I‚Äôm not sure exactly what day it updated.  I actually LIKED the mobile update  cause it was a little more simple to navigate & it allowed me to save log ins.  One complaint about the features is that there‚Äôs no cursor option now  which is okay but I think there will be times that I need it. Also rabb.it does have its own time bar but if I try to rewind or skip  or accidentally click the screen  then it restarts the whole episode and I can‚Äôt fix it.  Now onto my main complaints... THE MOBILE UPDATE IS SO BUGGY. Like one day I couldn‚Äôt even view my logins  they refused to load. Another day NONE of the search bars would work; I‚Äôd try to look up a show I searched before & it wouldn‚Äôt even give any me suggestions.  I couldn‚Äôt enter a URL either  even if it was the homepage of a site that I had just copy & pasted from my browser.  Also I don‚Äôt THINK the mobile version is compatible with the desktop version? Because apparently only mobile  not desktop  has ‚Äúgroups‚Äù which is a new feature it seems. When you click ‚Äúwatch now‚Äù on mobiles  it seems automatically makes a group for you/takes you to the last group you were in  not to your room?? Anyways now the show I‚Äôm watching isn‚Äôt loading correctly  it doesn‚Äôt seem to be starting at the right time  and it only has audio while the screen is all black.... I even restarted my phone and logged in & out. Nothing worked.   I hope no one sees this negative review and thinks I‚Äôm just being senseless. I like rabbit and I thank them so much for giving my friends and I this platform  but it‚Äôs annoyed me a helluva lot. I‚Äôm just being honest not only so rabb.it can improve or fix these problems  but also so people don‚Äôt expect so much from the app and end up hating it.

At rabb.it that is. I love the app/site & hate it at the same time. I‚Äôve really held off way too long to leave a review. This has been a fairly popular site for a few years and on paper it‚Äôs an awesome idea! But why haven‚Äôt the creators figured it out yet...?  Before the site was difficult for me to navigate  and certain things would take forever to load (trust me it‚Äôs not just my connection).  It had big update recently; haven‚Äôt used the app in maybe a month so I‚Äôm not sure exactly what day it updated.  I actually LIKED the mobile update  cause it was a little more simple to navigate & it allowed me to save log ins.  One complaint about the features is that there‚Äôs no cursor option now  which is okay but I think there will be times that I need it. Also rabb.it does have its own time bar but if I try to rewind or skip  or accidentally click the screen  then it restarts the whole episode and I can‚Äôt fix it.  Now onto my main complaints... THE MOBILE UPDATE IS SO BUGGY. Like one day I couldn‚Äôt even view my logins  they refused to load. Another day NONE of the search bars would work; I‚Äôd try to look up a show I searched before & it wouldn‚Äôt even give any me suggestions.  I couldn‚Äôt enter a URL either  even if it was the homepage of a site that I had just copy & pasted from my browser.  Also I don‚Äôt THINK the mobile version is compatible with the desktop version? Because apparently only mobile  not desktop  has ‚Äúgroups‚Äù which is a new feature it seems. When you click ‚Äúwatch now‚Äù on mobiles  it seems automatically makes a group for you/takes you to the last group you were in  not to your room?? Anyways now the show I‚Äôm watching isn‚Äôt loading correctly  it doesn‚Äôt seem to be starting at the right time  and it only has audio while the screen is all black.... I even restarted my phone and logged in & out. Nothing worked.   I hope no one sees this negative review and thinks I‚Äôm just being senseless. I like rabbit and I thank them so much for giving my friends and I this platform  but it‚Äôs annoyed me a helluva lot. I‚Äôm just being honest not only so rabb.it can improve or fix these problems  but also so people don‚Äôt expect so much from the app and end up hating it.

A lot of the functions - photos  calendar  and a private chat - are really nice and enjoyable to use  but I do have an issue with a bug and also the feasibility of the calendar function.  1. For the call function  every time I hit the call button and start a call  if I have to end the call and call again  I cannot start a call through the call buttons (either in chat or by clicking on their profile) unless I restart the app  which I assume resets the button click function. Not sure how the program works but adding a flag for in call may be helpful. Slight bug but causes a slight inconvenience which gets annoying overtime.  2. Also for the call function  it would be nice if there was a video call and hold function  which seem to be pretty standard across social apps.  3. I like the overall idea of the calendar and I think it's pretty awesome to be able to have my events  my so's events  and shared events  but the fact that you cannot import or sync calendars from either apple or google calendars is really inconvenient. I'm surprised that there's an option to export single events  but again  it would be much easier to export the whole calendar as well. I have all my events and tagged logged in my apple/google calendars (about 30-40 events a week)  which also give me appropriate notifications along with travel times. For me to have to manually input each event once again in the Between calendar is a lot of extra time  so I end up not using the function  even though I really enjoy the idea.  I think if these functions were fixed/added  especially the calendar  I would invest in premium  but at this point  the app acts more like a regular messaging app. Although it separates my conversations with one person with the rest  I can also do that with any other messaging app  but only add one friend on it. Overall  pretty good idea but execution needs to be refined more.

UPDATE 9/14: Still no communication from Between or official fixes  but I did find a way to download an old version. 5.2.2 is the last version that actually works. We‚Äôre able to use the app again  but the lack of support (not to mention the issue in the first place!) is unacceptable. Leaving this at 1* until they actually fix the problem.   UPDATE 8/3: 5.3.3 made it WORSE! Previously my partners phone worked correctly. Now BOTH of our devices are saving all sent pictures to the camera roll.   UPDATE 7/10: 5.3.2 still broken. Support still hasn't responded to me. I guess it's only been a month  so...  UPDATE 7/4/18: version 5.3.1 still has the issue. I've done a factory restore and it hasn't helped. I did get a response from the dev - thanking me for my suggestion to automatically save pics to the camera roll  but letting me know that since this is a privacy focused app  they may not implement my idea. My rage knows no bounds.   UPDATE 6/19/18: New version of the app - yay! Issue still exists - booo! First active developer I've ever encountered who ignores support emails and Facebook/Instagram DMs. I never would have bought Plus if I'd known they cared so little.   UPDATE 6/17/18: Three weeks later  the developer is STILL totally MIA. No we're aware of the issue." No "Can we get more information?" Nothing. I've sent follow up emails. I've tried messaging them on Facebook (their bot just sends you to the same worthless email). The "Report a Problem" link here goes to the same email too. If you're going to have one email  how about actually checking it occassionally?  Original review: As a long time user and recent Between Plus lifetime subscriber  I'm really sad to be writing a one star review. However  I recently discovered something that's a HUGE issue for a privacy app like this. When my partner sends a picture  it automatically saves a copy to the camera roll. This doesn't happen on my phone  nor is there a setting to disable it (that I've found  anyways). I've written to Between support asking for help  but there has been no response. The potential embarrassment of this issue is huge. Fortunately WE found the issue instead of our kids or a friend.   Until this gets fixed  the app is useless to us. There are plenty of other encrypted messenger apps. If the developer cares enough to either fix the issue or respond to my pleas for help (it's only been two weeks of complete silence)  I'll update this review."

My boyfriend and I have been long distance for a while  and this app has been phenomenal! We can also voice call (no video call  sorry!) or chat via the personal message feature. I like the inherent privacy that the app provides... it‚Äôs a special place for just me and my partner! I would highly recommend this app for any long distance couple!

UPDATE 9/14: Still no communication from Between or official fixes  but I did find a way to download an old version. 5.2.2 is the last version that actually works. We‚Äôre able to use the app again  but the lack of support (not to mention the issue in the first place!) is unacceptable. Leaving this at 1* until they actually fix the problem.   UPDATE 8/3: 5.3.3 made it WORSE! Previously my partners phone worked correctly. Now BOTH of our devices are saving all sent pictures to the camera roll.   UPDATE 7/10: 5.3.2 still broken. Support still hasn't responded to me. I guess it's only been a month  so...  UPDATE 7/4/18: version 5.3.1 still has the issue. I've done a factory restore and it hasn't helped. I did get a response from the dev - thanking me for my suggestion to automatically save pics to the camera roll  but letting me know that since this is a privacy focused app  they may not implement my idea. My rage knows no bounds.   UPDATE 6/19/18: New version of the app - yay! Issue still exists - booo! First active developer I've ever encountered who ignores support emails and Facebook/Instagram DMs. I never would have bought Plus if I'd known they cared so little.   UPDATE 6/17/18: Three weeks later  the developer is STILL totally MIA. No we're aware of the issue." No "Can we get more information?" Nothing. I've sent follow up emails. I've tried messaging them on Facebook (their bot just sends you to the same worthless email). The "Report a Problem" link here goes to the same email too. If you're going to have one email  how about actually checking it occassionally?  Original review: As a long time user and recent Between Plus lifetime subscriber  I'm really sad to be writing a one star review. However  I recently discovered something that's a HUGE issue for a privacy app like this. When my partner sends a picture  it automatically saves a copy to the camera roll. This doesn't happen on my phone  nor is there a setting to disable it (that I've found  anyways). I've written to Between support asking for help  but there has been no response. The potential embarrassment of this issue is huge. Fortunately WE found the issue instead of our kids or a friend.   Until this gets fixed  the app is useless to us. There are plenty of other encrypted messenger apps. If the developer cares enough to either fix the issue or respond to my pleas for help (it's only been two weeks of complete silence)  I'll update this review."

My boyfriend and I have been long distance for a while  and this app has been phenomenal! I would highly recommend this app for any long distance couple!

I've had this app since it came out  and have used it so much since I know how to use it with my eyes shut. I've met friends  girlfriends  and just people who are good to chat with through it.   In some of the more recent updates there's been some issues; like search distance inaccuracy  failure to update  and messages not sending  but these are the worst. Fix these small annoyances and the rating is right back up to five.   Overall  Whoshere is one of those staple apps out there for sociability. Perhaps allowing a larger pool of search results would be nicer  but this app does what it does the best and to date there's nothing similar that's even slightly better.

I love the iPhone and this app! Initially I didn't take any people on this seriously and just talked to a few people to pass the time when I was working. A few weeks after downloading the app  a nice guy sent me a message. I got the urge to block him a few times simply because I didn't see the point in talking to him! ( I was sceptical of the men on the app since most wanted to cyber) He was consistently sweet and respectful toward me.  Thank God I didn't block him because he is now my boyfriend and we have been happily together for 4 months and I recently went to meet his parents! It makes me feel sick that I almost blocked him because he is truly the love of my life!   Give this app a chance! There are many crazy strange people on it but you may find a great friend and/or more! I guess he and I got extremely lucky!

Pros: I like that I can check detailed stats wherever and I love that I can change my loadout on the fly between rounds.   Cons: I really dislike how many little bugs there are and I absolutely hate the one big one I've found in particular:  - If I open this app while I'm signed in and playing BF1 on console I will immediately be booted from any game that may be in progress and I am taken back to the home screen with no connection to EA servers. This can happen at any point  not just in a match  and occurs about 20% of the time. (XboxOne. iPhone6)  I like the potential here  but I frankly don't think this app does anything more than add to the long list of issues your games already have. column2: So  I bought the Early Enlister edition of Battlefield 1  and I thought to myself  There's a companion app? I might as well get that too". The night  I wasn't able to sleep  partly because of playing BF1 until 3 am but also reasons. I decided to scroll through the app. I was very pleased to see that it displays most  if not all  stats  allows you to customize loadouts(for the 4 base classes  not the vehicle classes for some reason)  and it allows you to distinguish what each variant of weapon does. I enjoy the app. It does what it does well enough. However it can make improvements here and there. For example  maybe a battlepack system to open battlepacks and view skins. Or a way to observe the 3D models of the vehicles and their skins. Allow customization of the tanker and pilot classes. But  the biggest issue I have with it so far  is the information it displays is out of sync. Like  I'm easily at rank 2 with all classes  but the app displays my class progress to be between rank 1 and 2. It's pretty bothersome to say the least. However  other than those few critiques  I think this does it's job well enough to receive 3 stars.   P.S. For those complaining about other Battlefield game to not be supported on this app  get a cheapo laptop and use that for Battlelog with the other games. It works just as well  if not better."

Compared to the Battlelog App used for Battlefield 3  Battlefield 4  & Battlefield Hardline; this streamlined version is a small step backwards from what it used to be.   The majority of features available from the Battlelog system or no longer in this app. Instead  you get a bunch of news feeds and videos for you to read and watch which feels like a social media platform and in my opinion feels completely pointless.   On top of that  you can no longer save your best battles that you played. Also  Battlefield 3 statistics are not even counted toward your Career"  a major step in the wrong direction! (Battlefield Hardline is not counted as well  but they say that will come in a latter update).  However  the new streamlined look makes tracking your stats much easier then in previous versions  but why EA & DICE don't put these in the game itself will always make no sense to me. The creation of custom emblems on a mobile device instead of going to a PC is a nice feature to have now  and doing changing your loadout on the go is fast and simple.   Overall  the new look performs well  but removing features that people liked while adding new ones is not the way to go. Don't take away  leave it alone and add more!   3/5 (Would rate 2.5/5 if possible)."
column5: What Happened To Battlelog & BF3 Stats?
